gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: DOC/NOAA/NESDIS/NCEI > National Centers for Environmental Information, NESDIS, NOAA, U.S. Department of Commerce
Scientific Data Stewardship provided by the National Geophysical Data Center, NESDIS, NOAA, U.S. Department of Commerce.

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Collection includes a variety of space weather datasets from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration and from the World Data Service for Geophysics, Boulder.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: To provide scientific data stewardship of solar-terrestrial datasets in compliance with NOAA Administrative Order (NAO) 212-15, "Management of Environmental and Geospatial Data and Information", dated 04 Nov 10. Scientific Data Stewardship includes the Archive, Access, and Assessment (AAA) of operational and related solar and space environmental datasets.

gmd:credit.gco:CharacterString: Data access provided by the NOAA Solar and Terrestrial Physics Division. Numerous solar observatories have contributed to this collection - please refer to the Lineage section of this metadata record.

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: Access Constraints: None Use Constraints: None Distribution Liability: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Data provided by various solar observatories located worldwide. Data record range is from 1818 to present.

gmd:supplementalInformation.gco:CharacterString: Collection consists of tabular lists and information related to solar features

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: Collection includes a variety of solar feature datasets contributed by a number of national and private solar observatories located worldwide. Collection includes lists of optical solar flares observed in H-alpha and x-rays, solar radio data, prominences and filaments, plague regions and faculae, and sunspots.

gmd:specification.gco:CharacterString: Most data provided in Adobe Portable Document Format (pdf).
Some data provide in American Standard Code for Information Interchange (ASCII) text format.
Some data provided in non-standard formats

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: DOC/NOAA/NESDIS/NCEI > National Centers for Environmental Information, NESDIS, NOAA, U.S. Department of Commerce

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Numerous datasets pertaining to space weather.

gmd:fees.gco:CharacterString: Data can be downloaded free of charge.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Numerous space environmental datasets are available at the website.

gmd:other.gco:CharacterString: NOAA National Centers for Environmental Information

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: NOAA created the National Centers for Environmental Information (NCEI) by merging NOAA's National Climatic Data Center (NCDC), National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), and National Oceanographic Data Center (NODC), including the National Coastal Data Development Center (NCDDC), per the Consolidated and Further Continuing Appropriations Act, 2015, Public Law 113-235. NCEI launched publicly on April 22, 2015.

gmd:evaluationMethodDescription.gco:CharacterString: Collection includes a variety of solar feature datasets contributed by a number of national and private solar observatories located worldwide. Collection includes lists of optical solar flares observed in H-alpha and x-rays, solar radio data, prominences and filaments, plague regions and faculae, and sunspots. The collection is as complete as possible with all available data online.
Datasets prepared by professional staff within the Solar and Terrestrial Physics Division at the National Geophysical Data Center and at other facilities.

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: Datasets prepared by professional staff within the Solar and Terrestrial Physics Division at the National Geophysical Data Center and at other facilities.

gmd:evaluationMethodDescription.gco:CharacterString: Consistent data presentation formats are used for each separate dataset.
Drawings are properly rotated into a heliocentric coordination orientation // Top is north // Right is east. [TBD]
Solar images and drawings were obtained and/or prepared by trained staff at the various institutions.
Supporting metatdata included within the images and drawings as available.
Daily solar images and drawings are annotated with the observation time and other relevant metadata.

gmd:statement.gco:CharacterString: Authoritative data provided by various institutions.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Original film and paper records digitized through the NOAA Climate Data Modernization Program (CDMP).
The NOAA Solar and Terrestrial Physics Division is responsible for managing this collection.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Collection included as a part of the NGDC Official Archive.

NOAA's National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC) provides scientific stewardship, products, and services for geophysical data from the Sun to the Earth and Earth's sea floor and solid earth environment, including Earth observations from space.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Kandilli Observatory and Earthquake Research Institute

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Geophysics Department at Bogazici University, Kandilli Observatory and Earthquake Research Institute gives the highest priority to original research with the aim of promoting young researchers and scientists reflecting the mobility of the modern science and the fast progress in technology within their research, together with the essential human qualities such as environmental awareness and preservation of the nature, while identifying and providing solutions in the part of the world we are living.
Flares observed in x-rays.

NOAA's National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC) provides scientific stewardship, products, and services for geophysical data from the Sun to the Earth and Earth's sea floor and solid earth environment, including Earth observations from space.
Sudden ionospheric disturbances.

NOAA's National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC) provides scientific stewardship, products, and services for geophysical data from the Sun to the Earth and Earth's sea floor and solid earth environment, including Earth observations from space.
Solar radio data at discrete frequencies.

The mission of Air Force Weather Agency is to maximize America's power through the exploitation of timely, accurate and relevant weather information; anytime, everywhere. AFWA is a Field Operating Agency, reporting to United States Air Force Director of Weather, Deputy Chief of Staff Air and Space Operations (USAF/A3O-W).
Solar radio swept frequency data.

The mission of Air Force Weather Agency is to maximize America's power through the exploitation of timely, accurate and relevant weather information; anytime, everywhere. AFWA is a Field Operating Agency, reporting to United States Air Force Director of Weather, Deputy Chief of Staff Air and Space Operations (USAF/A3O-W).

Penticton solar radio data - F10.7.

The Solar Radio Monitoring Program is a service operated jointly by National Research Council Canada and the Canadian Space Agency. Its function is to provide current and archival values of the 10.7cm Solar Flux solar activity index to any user to whom it might be of use.
Solar radio spectral event data (compiled).

NOAA's National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC) provides scientific stewardship, products, and services for geophysical data from the Sun to the Earth and Earth's sea floor and solid earth environment, including Earth observations from space.
Daily solar radio maps at 9.1 cm.

The Stanford Solar Center is dedicated to sharing the joy and excitement of solar science exploration. Acting as the education and public outreach arm of the Solar Observatories Group, and funded by NASA, the Solar Center provides resources, activities, and projects relating to the Sun for teachers, students, and the public.
Solar calcium plage data (various providers).

NOAA's National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC) provides scientific stewardship, products, and services for geophysical data from the Sun to the Earth and Earth's sea floor and solid earth environment, including Earth observations from space.
Solar calcium plage index (various providers).

NOAA's National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC) provides scientific stewardship, products, and services for geophysical data from the Sun to the Earth and Earth's sea floor and solid earth environment, including Earth observations from space.

NOAA's National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC) provides scientific stewardship, products, and services for geophysical data from the Sun to the Earth and Earth's sea floor and solid earth environment, including Earth observations from space.
Photoheliographic data (Greenwich).

gmd:name.gco:CharacterString: Royal Observatory Greenwich, Royal Museums Greenwich

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: The Royal Observatory, Greenwich is the home of Greenwich Mean Time and the Prime Meridian of the World, making it the official starting point for each new day and year. It is also home to London's only planetarium, the Harrison timekeepers and the UK's largest refracting telescope.
Solar photometric measurements.
The San Fernando Observatory (SFO) is a solar research facility associated with the California State University, Northridge (CSUN).
Sunspot positions and areas (various providers).

NOAA's National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC) provides scientific stewardship, products, and services for geophysical data from the Sun to the Earth and Earth's sea floor and solid earth environment, including Earth observations from space.

gmd:dataset.gco:CharacterString: Update collection for the Space Weather Prediction Center daily full sun drawings as data becomes available, including missing records (all observatories).

gmd:maintenanceNote.gco:CharacterString: This metadata was automatically generated from the Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata: Extensions for Remote Sensing Metadata standard version FGDC-STD-012-2002 using the June 2011 version of the FGDC RSE to ISO 19115-2 transform. The Spatial Reference Information is not currently mapped over to ISO but will be mapped in future versions.
This record was automatically modified on 2015-10-02 to include references to NCEI where applicable.
